natural_language_example: A city has several demand points (e.g., public transportation hubs, malls, and residential complexes) where users need access to e-scooters. The city has identified several candidate locations (based on security, space availability, and accessibility) where scooters can be placed. The goal is to select a subset of these candidate locations and determine the number of new scooters to add, such that the total user travel distance to reach a scooter is minimized. Constraints include limiting the number of selected locations, ensuring all demand is satisfied, and not exceeding the maximum number of new scooters that can be added.
